intro: Helichrysum albicans var. lanuginosum, commonly known as the white绒毛金盏花, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It features compact, bushy growth with hairy, glandular leaves that are often covered in fine white hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish to golden flowers arranged in dense, compact heads. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens or dry landscapes. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its long-lasting flowers and drought tolerance.
